options.content:
Request Throughput


2xx status codes denote a successful model prediction. 4xx status codes are common when clients POST data that does not meet the expected schema. We calculate the success rate as the percentage of HTTP requests that do not return a 5xx code.

panels.description: Percentage of requests that returned 2xx and 4xx status codes.
panels.title: HTTP Success Rate (1m avg)

panels.description: Rate of requests by status code.
panels.title: Rate of Requests

options.content:
Request Latencies


We have two SLOs for API latency:
- Average latency SLO is breached if p50 latencies exceed 50ms for 5 minutes. - Extreme latency SLO is breached if p99 latencies exceed 300ms for 5 minutes.

panels.description: Total number of requests being processed at the moment.
panels.title: Requests In Progress

panels.description: The amount of time taken for all endpoints in the API to respond, on average.
panels.title: Server Latency

options.content:
Total Requests


In some use cases, it may be important to know the total number of hits to a certain endpoint.

panels.description: Disk space used of all filesystems mounted
panels.title: Disk Space Used Basic

options.content:
Prediction Latencies


We have two SLOs for Prediction latency:
- Average latency SLO is breached if p50 latencies exceed 50ms for 5 minutes. - Extreme latency SLO is breached if p99 latencies exceed 300ms for 5 minutes.

panels.description: The amount of time taken for prediction endpoint in the API to respond.
panels.title: Inference Latency

options.content:
Prediction Distribution


This prediction distribution shows the percentage of each predicted class against all predictions.

panels.description: Percentage of predicted class over total predictions
panels.title: Prediction Distribution

options.content:
P-Value


This metric is useful in determining if a drift was detected in the input data.

Red value indicates drift. (Scaled up by 1x10^2)
